      • runEvent

        public final void runEvent(Event event)

      • setup

        public void setup()

      • declarePriorities

        public abstract void declarePriorities()

      • onMessage

        public void onMessage(MessageEvent event)
        This is fired whenever a message is sent to a channel by anyone. This does nothing, but can be overridden if additional uses are needed when a message is sent. This will fire after the CommandManager has already passed the command on to a CommandExecutor and so will occur after a command, if one was found.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel the message is from.
        sender - The nickname that sent the message.
        login - The login of the person who sent the message.
        hostname - The host name of the person who sent the message
        message - The entire message that was sent by the sender.

      • onJoin

        public void onJoin(JoinEvent event)
        This is fired when anyone joins a channel the bot is in. This does nothing, but can be overridden with each CommandExecutor that is defined in the RalexBot where each will be ran sequentially.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel the message is from.
        sender - The nickname that sent the message.
        login - The login of the person who sent the message.
        hostname - The host name of the person who sent the message

      • onPrivateMessage

        public void onPrivateMessage(PrivateMessageEvent event)
        This is fired when anyone joins a channel the bot is in. This does nothing, but can be overridden with each CommandExecutor that is defined in the RalexBot where each will be ran sequentially.
        Parameters:
        sender - The nickname that sent the message.
        login - The login of the person who sent the message.
        hostname - The host name of the person who sent the message
        message - The entire message that was sent by the sender.

      • onPart

        public void onPart(PartEvent event)
        This is fired when anyone parts a channel the bot is in. This does nothing, but can be overridden with each CommandExecutor that is defined in the RalexBot where each will be ran sequentially.
        Parameters:
        channel - The channel the message is from.
        sender - The nickname that sent the message.
        login - The login of the person who sent the message.
        hostname - The host name of the person who sent the message

      • onQuit

        public void onQuit(QuitEvent event)
        This is fired when anyone quits the network the bot is in. This does nothing, but can be overridden with each CommandExecutor that is defined in the RalexBot where each will be ran sequentially.
        Parameters:
        sourceNick - The nick the person who quit was using
        sourceLogin - The login of the person who quit
        sourceHostname - The hostname of the person who quit
        reason - The reason when quitting

      • onNickChange

        public void onNickChange(NickChangeEvent event)
        Parameters:
        oldNick - The old nick of the user
        login - The login name of the user
        hostname - The hostname of the user
        newNick - The new nick of the user

      • onCommand

        public void onCommand(CommandEvent event)
        The command system. This is fired from the main driver and runs when the core has found a command. This only will though fire the onCommand() method which the core determined is the most appropriate one to use
        Parameters:
        command - The name of the command that is used.
        sender - The name of the user of the command.
        channel - The channel the command was used in.
        args - The arguments that was sent with the command

      • getAliases

        public java.lang.String[] getAliases()
        Returns the aliases the command can be triggered by. Multiple aliases can be specified and each will trigger the command assuming they are not overridden by another CommandExecutor
        Returns:

      • isMaster

        public final boolean isMaster(java.lang.String user)
        Checks to see if the specified user is the bot's master. This is hard-coded in, where null is the console.
        Parameters:
        user - The user to test.
        Returns:
        True if user is the master, otherwise false

      • replacePlaceHolders

        public java.lang.String replacePlaceHolders(java.lang.String sender,
                                   java.lang.String channel,
                                   java.lang.String message,
                                   java.lang.String[] args)
        This will replace certain placeholders in a string.

        This only will change {User}, {Channel}, and {#}.

        Parameters:
        sender - The person which replaces {User}
        channel - The channel to replace {Channel} with
        message - The message to edit
        args - The arguments that are also passed
        Returns:
        The new string with placeholders filled with provided information

      • isOP

        public final boolean isOP(java.lang.String name,
           java.lang.String channel)
        This looks to see if a nick is op in a specific channel the bot is in.
        Parameters:
        name - The nick of the person to test.
        channel - The channel to see if they are op in
        Returns:
        True if the nick is op in the channel, false otherwise

      • isVoice

        public final boolean isVoice(java.lang.String name,
              java.lang.String channel)
        This looks to see if a nick is voiced in a specific channel the bot is in.
        Parameters:
        name - The nick of the person to test.
        channel - The channel to see if they are voiced in
        Returns:
        True if the nick is voiced in the channel, false otherwise

      • sendMessage

        public final void sendMessage(java.lang.String target,
               java.lang.String message)
        Sends a single message to a person or channel.
        Parameters:
        target - The nick or channel to send the message to.
        message - The message to send to the user/channel.

      • sendMessage

        public final void sendMessage(java.lang.String target,
               java.lang.String[] message)
        Sends a collections of messages to a person or channel. Each line in the array will be sent to the target assuming the target is not null.
        Parameters:
        target - The channel or person to send the messages to.
        message - The collection of messages to send.

      • sendNotice

        public final void sendNotice(java.lang.String target,
              java.lang.String[] message)
        Sends a collections of messages to a person or channel. Each line in the array will be sent to the target assuming the target is not null.
        Parameters:
        target - The channel or person to send the messages to.
        message - The collection of messages to send.

      • sendNotice

              java.lang.String message)
